column4: no, what device, you say its not working.. so what is the wireless device you're trying to get working
whats the wireless device?
what do you mean? The security? or what?
my computer
huh?
wireless internet?
didn't you say you had a wireless problem you were trying to diagnose? maybe i confused you w/ someone else
My computer won't connect to the wireless internet is my problem
ok.. so... what is your wireless device, jesus..
a router
00:12:0 Network controller: Intersil Corporation Prism 2.5 Wavelan chipset (rev 01)
what are you trying to do w/ the old dell?
just make it wireless usable for my little sisters
i imagine a machine that old, wireless should probably be easy.. i'm guessing its a broadcom.. have you figured out what device it is yet, or have you got that far
usually you can find that option by right clicking the networking applet.
which driver did you install and attempt to get to work?
the B43 Wireless Driver (which worked last time when I was using Linux Mint)
did you try modprobing the driver?
I'm sorry but, what? How can I do this?
hang on
copy paste these two commands one at a time in the terminal... http://pastebin.com/chRLy3Ws
then afterwards, wait about 10-15sec, and see if your wireless opens.
for both I got the same result "FATAL: Module wl not found." sounds bad :(
yeah, somethin isn't right... you don't have the driver.
